alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 9:03PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Ulster and southwestern Dutchess Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 903 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over Maplewood, or near Monticello, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ellenville and Napanoch around 940 PM EDT. Kerhonkson around 945 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Cherrytown, Tuckers Corner, Rolling Meadows, Maple Hill, Glenford, Atwood, Pacama, Brodhead, Hillside and Stone Ridge. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster
